demographics.name: John Smith
demographics.supportServices: Social Work consult placed 03/25/25 for coping support.
demographics.mobility: Ambulates independently, no assistive devices needed at baseline.

diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: New onset focal seizures (left arm twitching), persistent headache.
pathologyFindings: Features include significant cellular pleomorphism, high mitotic activity, microvascular proliferation, and palisading necrosis.
Immunohistochemistry: GFAP positive, ATRX retained, IDH1 R132H negative.
diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: Maximal safe surgical resection (03/15/2025) by Dr. Robert White (Neurosurgery)

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) with concurrent Temozolomide (TMZ)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: Post-operative tumor bed with margins, treated via two VMAT arcs.
treatmentPlan.techniqueSummary: Volumetric Modulated Arc Therapy (VMAT) used to deliver a highly conformal dose distribution.
treatmentPlan.concurrentChemo: Temozolomide 75 mg/m^2 PO Daily during radiation (Managed by Dr. Chen)
medications: Dexamethasone 2 mg PO BID (Tapering schedule planned)
Levetiracetam 750 mg PO BID (for seizure prophylaxis)
therapistAlerts: Monitor for seizure activity pre/post treatment.
Patient may experience mild confusion post-treatment; ensure he has his way home planned.
High risk for fatigue; encourage patient to rest as needed.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine, head neutral in custom Aquaplast mask indexed to table. Patient aligned to room lasers using anterior and bilateral marks on mask.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point marks on thermoplastic mask aligned to room lasers. Isocenter set at L-1.5, L+2.0, V+5.0 relative to CT sim reference point.

dosimetry.planStatus: Final - Approved by Dr. Evelyn Reed
dosimetry.constraints: Brainstem Max < 54 Gy; Chiasm Max < 54 Gy; R Optic Nrv Max < 54 Gy; L Optic Nrv Max < 54 Gy. All constraints met.
dosimetry.planNotes: Standard of care adjuvant chemoradiation for GBM.

fractions.setupNotes: CBCT match to bony anatomy, no adjustments needed.
fractions.notes: Tolerated well. Educated on TMZ administration.

fractions.setupNotes: CBCT match. Shifts V:0.1, L:0, L:-0.1. Approved.
fractions.notes: Weekly OTV today. Labs reviewed. Cleared to continue.

imagingAndReports.summary: Glioblastoma, WHO Grade IV, IDH-wt, MGMT-unmethylated.

reportDetails.microscopicDescription: Sections show a hypercellular, diffusely infiltrating astrocytic glioma. Tumor cells exhibit marked nuclear pleomorphism and frequent, atypical mitotic figures. Microvascular proliferation and pseudopalisading necrosis are prominent.
reportDetails.molecularInformation: IDH1 (by IHC): Negative for R132H mutation. ATRX (by IHC): Retained. MGMT Promoter Methylation: Unmethylated.
reportDetails.comment: The histologic and molecular features are diagnostic of glioblastoma, IDH-wildtype, WHO Grade 4.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Evelyn Reed (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt seen post-op for R temporal GBM. Reviewed imaging, pathology (IDH-wt, MGMT-unmethylated). Discussed standard of care adjuvant chemoradiation (EBRT 60Gy/30fx w/ concurrent TMZ). Explained goals, procedure, potential side effects. Pt understands and agrees. Plan for CT Sim.

progressNotes.author: Mark Evans, RTT
progressNotes.summary: CT Sim completed for adjuvant brain RT. Aquaplast mask fabricated, patient immobilized supine. Tolerated well. Data sent for VMAT planning.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Evelyn Reed (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient completed 5/30 fractions RT with concurrent TMZ. Tolerating reasonably well. Mild fatigue reported. No significant nausea. Scalp care reviewed. CBC today noted, acceptable to continue. Continue current plan. Follow up weekly.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Adjuvant therapy to reduce risk of recurrence after surgery.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Fatigue, hair loss in treated area, skin redness, nausea/vomiting (from TMZ), lowered blood counts (from TMZ).
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Importance of scalp care, sun protection, managing fatigue.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT, take TMZ as prescribed, attend weekly OTVs and lab draws.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Take Temozolomide on empty stomach. Adhere to Dexamethasone taper schedule. Continue Levetiracetam consistently.

cptCharges.description: Intensity modulated radiation treatment delivery, complex
